item.title: ::givemaster [PLAYERNAME] HELP!
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

I want to make a command so if I do ::givemaster runefreak10 then it will give runefreak10 all 135 lvls. I have a ::master code already:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerRights >= 2) { addSkillXP(14910000, 0); addSkillXP(14910000, 1); addSkillXP(14910000, 2); addSkillXP(14910000, 3); addSkillXP(14910000, 4); addSkillXP(14910000, 5); addSkillXP(14910000, 6); addSkillXP(14910000, 7); addSkillXP(14910000, 8); addSkillXP(14910000, 9); addSkillXP(14910000, 10); addSkillXP(14910000, 11); addSkillXP(14910000, 12); addSkillXP(14910000, 13); addSkillXP(14910000, 14); addSkillXP(14910000, 15); addSkillXP(14910000, 16); addSkillXP(14910000, 17); addSkillXP(14910000, 18); addSkillXP(14910000, 19); addSkillXP(14910000, 20); addSkillXP(14910000, 21); addSkillXP(14910000, 22); addSkillXP(14910000, 23); }

But I want to make another code so when I do ::givemaster runefreak10 then it’ll give it to him. I tried this:

[code] if (command.startsWith(“givemaster”) && playerRights >= 10) {
String wingman = command.substring(11);
int index = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(wingman);

wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 0); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 1); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 2); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 3); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 4); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 5); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 6); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 7); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 8); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 9); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 10); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 11);
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 12); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 13); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 14); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 15); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 16); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 17); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 18); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 19); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 20); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 21); 
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 22);
wingman.addSkillXP(14910000, 23); 
}[/code]

I named my string wingman (don’t ask why lol. I think it’s funny) but it doesn’t work. It gives me errors. How would I go about fixing it?
